Those who stayed up into the early hours of Thursday morning got the best show with clear skies in some areas, treating photographers to picture-perfect moments. 29 spectacular photos of the Aurora Borealis over the UK and Ireland

Share
Tweet
What's This?
By Blathnaid Healy2015-10-08 10:15:27 UTC

LONDON — Aurora hunters were handsomely rewarded Wednesday night across the UK and Ireland as the greens, pinks and purples of the natural phenomenon illuminated the October night sky.

See also: Space Station astronauts got an awesome aurora show this weekend

The U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration had earlier Wednesday forecast a strong geomagnetic storm - meaning the conditions were perfect for a spectacular display.

Those who stayed up into the early hours of Thursday morning got the best show with clear skies in some areas, treating photographers to picture-perfect moments.

England

@metoffice @VirtualAstro stunning on Hadrian's Wall earlier this evening ! pic.twitter.com/o9kLUWpIqZ

— Cain Scrimgeour (@cainscrimgeour) October 7, 2015

@VirtualAstro RT: #NorthernLights and @IronMenCrosby at Crosby beach, Liverpool, tonight :-) #aurora Pic: @Gavtraff pic.twitter.com/jcN4xtA89g”

— Alfred the OK (@AlfredTheOK) October 7, 2015

Scotland

@virtualastro quite simply the greatest I've seen in Scotland, all taken close to home in Lanark, over 3hr period. pic.twitter.com/L3siaMoMaz

— Stuart Stevenson (@StevensonStuart) October 8, 2015

Aurora over Staffin on Skye tonight!! @SeanBattySTV @VirtualAstro pic.twitter.com/ToGLgSbw6O

— Alexander Macaskill (@alexmacas) October 7, 2015

RT “@Wild_Scotland: Last night's amazing #aurora dancing above Stirlingshire @metoffice @BBCBreakfast pic.twitter.com/9B5Uj37YHA”

— Brian Ferguson (@brianjaffa) October 8, 2015

Aurora so bright in the Scottish Borders I could see it reflected in Alemoor reservoir near Hawick pic.twitter.com/UKTYdhgPIC

— Sam Cornwell (@Samcornwell) October 7, 2015

From Port Glasgow tonight @SeanBattySTV @VirtualAstro amazing display!! pic.twitter.com/q2fs8ZjlDP

— Louise Gault (@louisegault) October 7, 2015

@VirtualAstro .. This is the #auroraborealis from #Islay looking across to #Jura this evening @BBCScotlandNews pic.twitter.com/XpfK84gBSI

— liberalisland (@LiberalIsland) October 7, 2015

Time for bed- happy wth little drive to see aurora earlier :) Kids 1st time too #Aurora @VirtualAstro @aurorawatchuk pic.twitter.com/nHiofwgq30

— ScotlandsMountains (@steamingboots) October 7, 2015

Wales

@metoffice here's my effort https://t.co/Voy6slJbZL pic.twitter.com/V4krk93L1t

— Grande Le Onion (@grandeleonion) October 7, 2015

Amazing display of Aurora Borealis Northern Lights from North Cumbria. @newsandstar @VirtualAstro @TamithaSkov pic.twitter.com/o4FVIS24re

— Stuart Walker (@StuWalkerPhotos) October 7, 2015

Pembrokeshire, Wales #Aurora #wahoo @VirtualAstro @Cmdr_Hadfield @BBCWalesNews @VisitPembs @PembsCoast pic.twitter.com/Q5uMsLgRw0

— Drew Buckley (@drewbphoto) October 7, 2015

Amazing Aurora again last night @RCTCouncil @BBCWalesNews @WalesOnline @LeightonAndrews @RhonddaBryant @radiojagger pic.twitter.com/WU1TTIuDFJ

— Allan Trow (@AlDarkSkyWales) October 8, 2015

Northern Ireland

@VirtualAstro Aurora from Craigavon, Co Armagh. pic.twitter.com/Ahvej9LRrp

— Paul Wharton (@paulwharton1970) October 8, 2015

@barrabest @WeatherCee @bbcnewsline @ILoveNorthCoast @officialcoolfm @VirtualAstro last nights aurora from Dunluce. pic.twitter.com/ZtOi6PQuzW

— Jason Murphy (@Jason_Murphy73) October 8, 2015

Aurora over Ballintoy last night @barrabest @WeatherCee @Aurora_ireland @EventsCwayCoast @CanonUKandIE @BobandBerts pic.twitter.com/g3M3wOFnW6

— Ken Cox (@coxcom15) October 7, 2015

Aurora mixed with frustrating Armagh rain clouds! Such a display!! It was raining during this shot! pic.twitter.com/ennOeKrGel

— Hibernia Landscapes (@Hiberniaphoto) October 7, 2015

Sister got to see Northern Lights at Corrymeela @barrabest pic.twitter.com/sI70CHcd7y

— Ciarán Armstrong (@Ciaran1471) October 7, 2015

@barrabest @WeatherCee View of aurora from outside the kitchen window tonight before the clouds #bt45 #magherafelt pic.twitter.com/uJzoQvLjJS

— steve gourley (@sgourl) October 7, 2015

Ireland

#Aurora Doagh Rosguill #Donegal #Awesome Great structure, curtains & fast movement pic.twitter.com/6ByNPkk9ye

— Daragh McDonough (@DaraghDonegal) October 8, 2015

Yay the Aurora made it to Kerry tonight :) @Aurora_ireland @Aurora_Alerts @photos_astro @gokerrylive @DiscoverIreland pic.twitter.com/iOUYPmSRe7

— Caroline Flynn (@_CarolineFlynn) October 8, 2015

#auroraborealis #carburycastle #kildare @Aurora_ireland @RalphMckeon pic.twitter.com/DK0672yt1z

— Adrian Leech (@peachie15) October 8, 2015

#Donegal #Inishowen #Aurora #Dunree Great start to the season @DonegalDaily @donegalpage pic.twitter.com/PuyFaEfzGO

— justin maclochlainn (@jmacrock) October 7, 2015

@metoffice Taken tonight from Grainan Fort in Co.Donegal Over looking Lough Swilly, #Ireland ! #NorthernLights pic.twitter.com/Nsl0bxVuRU

— Sean Campbell (@SCampbell2010) October 7, 2015

#Aurora over Ramelton in #Donegal tonight. Great to see it back! @Aurora_ireland pic.twitter.com/Le3F1o9SKs

— Pajo (@PAJO23) October 7, 2015

Until next time, Aurora Borealis. We'll be waiting.

Topics: aurora borealis, Space, UK, World, Climate
